1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Bidart Bros has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, Bidart Bros continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.

By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Bidart Bro's ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Bidart Bro's management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.

Bidart Bros has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.

In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Bidart Bros has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation.

1.3.2 Anhydrous Ammonia

The ammonia refrigeration process at the Bidart Bros facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year. It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.

Our refrigeration personnel monitor the ammonia refrigeration process and keep an active log book of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia. In addition, the process is checked frequently by one of the outside refrigeration contractors that we use. These contractors also assist in performing the annual mechanical integrity inspection of our ammonia equipment.  

1.4 Five Year Accident History

Bidart Bros has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.

1.2 Process Description

Facility Layout

Bidart Brothers operates a commercial cold storage for a variety of fruit and vegetables in Shafter, CA. The facility has an ammonia refrigeration system that provides refrigeration capacity to the following:
 
(2) Common Storage Rooms
(18) Controlled Atmosphere (CA) Rooms
(1) Loading Dock
(1) Precool Room
(1) Segregation Room
(1) Packing Room
(2) Storage Rooms
(2) Hallways

Refrigeration System Equipment
The refrigerated spaces are equipped with air-cooling evaporators and accumulators as required for flooded operation.
 
Most control valve groups are located on the roof/in the center hall (mezzanine) to provide easy access. The refrigeration machinery is contained within or directly above the machinery room. 
 
Process Classification

The ammonia refrigeration system at Bidart Brothers consists of vessels, equipment, and valves which are interconnected by piping. As such, the refrigeration system at Bidart Brothers is treated as a single process.

1.3 General Accident Release & Chemical Specific Prevention Steps

1.3.1 General 

We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meeting we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.

Bidart Bros has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the ammonia refrigeration process. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in PSMWriter and hard copy binders

Executive Summary

This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:
- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program - Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5
- Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) - Title 40 CFR §68
- California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR §5189
- Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR §1910.119

Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.

This program is intended to be a living document. As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Bidart Bros has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities.
